In October 2022, the site was renamed the Valley of the Quelga Muros under contentious legislation.

sentences.sentence: Hundreds of Armenians marched through their country's capital on Sunday to mark the anniversary of the Armenian genocide. It's a yearly event in which participants burn Turkish and Azerbaijani flags and carry torches to the city's genocide memorial in honour of the 1.5 million Armenians that were killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: April 24th, or Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day, marks the day in 1915 when intellectuals were first rounded up and killed in Ottoman Turkey. Turkey denies the genocide and says the death toll was the result of civil war and unrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Moscow has had to increase its armed force spending by 9%. Air pollution causes more than 1,200 children to die prematurely in Europe every year,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And it significantly increases the risk of illness among young people later in their lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The report says it is the main environmental risk for the health of minors and reduces life expectancy. And despite the progress made in recent years, the level of some of Europe's main air pollutants remain above the World Health Organization's recommendations, especially in Central and Eastern Europe, as well as in Italy. The effects of air pollution on the body begin before birth, as maternal exposure to the toxins increases the risk of low birth rates and premature births after birth pollution increases the risk of several health issues including asthma or respiratory failure and infection asthma affects around 9% of minors in Europe this study includes some 30 countries in Europe but the United Kingdom Russia and Ukraine were not included suggesting the situation on the continent could be much worse.
